text:
Negatory.
I did not fail, so your implication of failure on my part is second (after failure to capitalise the beginning of the sentence) of a long line of failures on your part.

text: A comment left by nicklon was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ButterMoths, madnes, hellofyellin, blastradius, DukieShane, kylank, atticusonline, Doc_Rostov, Wolfslice, Audhumla)

name: lateadopter
text:
Almost as quick as Roast Beef. Hence, the consecutive posts with different typos.

"Six hundred bucks is a move. That's the Serious threshhold."

- The Real Napster

PS: You can copy and paste alt text.

name: lateadopter
text: By the way, the preceding comment makes me a dick, not a fucker.  Fuckers have purpose and drive.  Dicks just hang around and point at other people.

name: estutius
text: The last sentence in your comment sounds like it was ripped straight out of a Jerkcity strip.

name: mirzabah
text: It's loosely based off of Bullet Tooth Tony's monologue from Snatch.

name: soticoto
text: A comment left by soticoto was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by hateandwar, tekende, ButterMoths, aargh, StagnantDisplay, GitarooMan, MortisInvictus, atticusonline, proof_man, Setzkin, jefftg7, usversusthem, Doc_Rostov, peterjoel, cjfoster)

name: saint
text:
Team America reference? I don't know dude, that's just barely better than quoting Family Guy on here.

Or am I wrong? This is possible.

name: soticoto
text: I come from a world where Matt Stone and Trey Parker are considered akin to gods.

name: razorman57
text: It's like a game of rock paper scissor, but everyone loses except for the dicks!

name: matthearn
text: Who wants to tell Onstad that "threshold" only has 2 Hs in it?

name: lateadopter
text: Greetings, my dick brother!

name: ford
text:
I love that this got a lame. Someone out there is so onstad-protective that they reflexively cried "No!" when someone pointed out a legitimate typo.


Now lame me, you bastards! I can take it!

name: fosters
text: You're not the boss of me! Chubby!

name: ford
text: What's really funny is that the alt text has been changed, and this comment streak no longer makes sense.

name: ford
text:
...and now I'm the only one that doesn't make sense.

Stay tuned for further updates!

name: razorman57
text: OR CAN YOU? dun dun dun DUNNNNNNNNNNNNNN

name: lrosetw8
text: Aw, it doesn't cost six hundo to fix the "main horn area". Prolly less than fifty would be fine.

name: duskbringer
text: Haha "We lookin' at six hundo". I actually used the word "hundo" this morning. It felt good. Like I was so familiar with hundreds of dollars that I could give them a nickname.

name: mcowgill
text:
i am fond on 'hunjie bag' for a hundred

although i am australian, perhaps this is a thing

name: solobuttons
text: So am I, and I could probably never bring myself to say that. Crikey, that's weird.

name: gormster
text: Man, a hunjie bag is five sticks of weed in a ziploc.

name: foea
text: Where do you live that they still sell weed on sticks?

name: spicyponyhead
text: The county fair in Northern California, maybe?

name: foea
text: Do they come dipped in caramel or something?

name: dracer2
text:
I'm Australian, and when I was a kid there were these trees that had these seeds that used to itch like hell when someone would put them down your shirt or whatever - we called them "itchy bombs."

Years later I moved to Japan, where the equivalent of a hundo is the 10,000yen bill, which people call an ichiman.

Anyway, I used to call ichimans itchy bombs and sometimes when I had a wad of them that I was spending freely I would say "I'm droping itchy bombs tonight, baby."

name: lateadopter
text:
I especially like the compound units in "a six hundo." Like "six hundo" is a single unit, and Ray's going to have to give one of them. If he stepped on the instrument in two places, he'd be looking at two six hundos.

- a real former linguist

name: foea
text: I think it's more like "a six hundo" is one unit of guilt.. two steps on the instrument would warrant "a seventeen hundo", not just double the monetary value but with an added measure. "A seventeen hundo" is the kind of gift you have to get someone when you accidentally sleep with their sister.

name: spicyponyhead
text: cunning

name: skviiier
text: stunt

name: dovey
text: First no-contest 5 for me in a while. This comic means business

name: natjo1986
text: A comment left by natjo1986 was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by stormypinkness, Flaaron, usversusthem, Wolfslice, jrizzle, unsentletter)

name: cargoweasel
text: How come all of Ray's previous six hundo level mistakes involve damaged musical instruments?  Is that a threshold?

name: nicklon
text:
I like to imagine them all making that classic 'I-just-stepped-on-a-musical-instrument' broken sound in an imaginary previous alternate dimensionish panel right before Ray faces the consequence that is six hundo

if this doesn't make sense it is because i've been drinking

name: catachresis
text: No, I know what you mean. The bit in the movie trailer where Ben Stiller steps on an accordion and it goes SKRONK and Ben Stiller makes an "OOPS!!!!!" face.

name: euphemisms
text: now i'm forever imagining a really fast pan in on ben stiller looking ever-so-troubled. "THAT'S a hundo!"

name: zedpower
text: I doubt Cornelius would just leave an instrument on the floor and under a towel. Maybe Lyle was feeling really pumped that day.

name: ham_shoes
text: I would blame Philippe first and then Lyle

name: j-man
text: Six hundred dollars mends even the most severe of wounds, but it's best not to err too often with your friends, because that shit costs money.

name: mortshire
text:
According to my bank statement, I currently have a Dudes Thoroughly Wronged Threshold of 1.7. Beyond that my only recourses are a free e-card with tinny music and dubious Flash animation or a Sexual Favor.
I'd better watch where I step until payday.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
or try www.apologies4men.com.

ps. it is not a Good website.

name: tekende
text: Listen, I need to borrow some money.

name: 1000hz
text: It seems the secondary key area and ternary mouthpiece area remain relatively unharmed. Good thing, because we would have been lookin' at dropping about 6K each.

name: rotating-dog
text: I wish fancy new guitars only cost six hundred dollars.

name: persnicket
text: this strip made me smile so good that it went all the way round and turned a frown into of it :|| sweet-assed travail onstad take a knee (a knee)

name: persnicket
text: never say lame

name: hannah
text: ray just has no idea about how much things cost, but he likes to sound as though he knows exactly what he's talking about. the knowing nod, the informal useage of 'hundo' - he's like a cowboy builder who'll spend all his time while you're out of the house making ice and watching your big tv. not in a mean way. he just wanted to hang out.

name: fuckyoufriday
text:
Heh, yeah. Ray's like Rain Man or something.

"Hey Ray, how much does it cost to fix the bell of a classy French horn?"; "Six hundred dollars! Yeah, def'nitely six hundred dollars."

"Well, how much should you spend on a gift to bribe your best friend into forgiving you for a basically unforgivable act?" ; "...six hundred dollars?"

name: dusty
text: Except his magical tard savant power is not math but partying.

name: mike24
text: If that is a tuxedo that ray is wearing in strip 5, then this is my favourite strip ever.

name: phthoggos
text: I know people are feeling like Ray's getting overexposed but how can you not love this

name: padijun
text: Man, Cornelius was too lazy to pawn it and he knew Ray would step on it and pay him $600 (which was more than a pawnshop would give him)

name: aperson
text: Those damn freedom horns are all metric. You just can't get the parts.

name: fuckyoufriday
text: Knowing "Connie", it's probably a handmade antique. These horns are not modular.

name: tekende
text: Yeah, parts of them are modular but I'm pretty sure that the main horn area is not. I still don't think it would cost $600 to buff it out though.

name: lrosetw8
text: haha, Freedom Horn... yes.

name: gormster
text:
Surely the thing to do would be to buy Beef an iPhone.

Then again, he'd probably hate it because everyone else likes it. He's a bit of a snob that way.

name: lastlarf
text: He has expressed heavy disdain for Apple Products before. "looks like they got jeff goldblum writin' the ads and the os... talk about a computer which basically has AIDs."

name: tellumo
text:
Definitely. Beef's holding out for Android .

As am I.

name: spicyponyhead
text: is it everything you hoped for?

name: mr_pete
text:
...Then spoke Egil Stronginthearm:
The fault is mine, the wergild must be paid.
three swords, nine rings, and six hundo...

From the Saga of Eorl (Barmestead Codex, trans. Machealy)

name: cpnglxynchos
text: hilarious.

name: carrollhach
text: Six hundred bucks might buy Cornelius a french horn case but serious horns start at about three grand. On the other hand, Teo's guitar was likely a pawn shop find, so he's have plenty left over.

name: apatfan
text: dang man, he ain't gotta replace the whole horn... just the MAIN HORN AREA.  Mind the details

name: mr_lostman28
text: Is there a lesser to "doing it up with christmas lights and a pony?"... like "Man I really done it up with easter eggs and reindeer this time... thats bout a cool 3 hundo right there".... ??

name: aarongstock
text: "party favors and a hamster... half-a-hundo"

name: factorial
text: "Sock-puppet show and a housefly... ten bucks"

name: kilovictorsierra
text: That'd be referred to as one-tenth a hundo, or a "huh" for short.

name: gussiejives
text: High school CPR class was always weird with those plastic dolls with the gaping mouths and the pump in their chests.  I mean, who knows what those creepy instructors were doing with those dummies just 20 minutes prior to class....

name: aarongstock
text:
And that's why it's good we can't give CPR via genitalia.

Among other reasons.

name: gussiejives
text: Yeah, it's a shame the intercostal muscles don't extend into the pubic area.

name: jackparsons
text: This an all-new perspective on the queef.

name: griggs_although
text: ...Boned?

name: apatfan
text: I love that you're seeing his thought bubble... and then the captions at the bottom seem to be inner dialogue as well.  He's having a thought WITHIN a thought.  Ray is a thinkin man

name: aperson
text: I thought that was The Author, Elucidating.

name: tekende
text: It was Edward Gorey, sneaking into the comic from beyond the grave.

name: jujubeesforjesus
text: A comment left by jujubeesforjesus was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by stormypinkness, silver_lake, equinn2006, jmmfgd)

name: ethelthefrog
text: chubby just for your siffle and ollie pic. rock!

name: zpj0001
text: Intentional reference to Beef having already been established as The Six Hundred Dollar Man ?

name: fuckyoufriday
text: Way to cite precedent, dude!

name: kingsleymc
text:
"...but I did."

How great is it that he's looking down at it like a scolded child. A child with 6 hundred dollars to give.

name: morganization
text: in high school the same thing happened to my trumpet and i would say it cost the guy about six hundo to fix

name: brokeaccount
text: Tut, you shouldn't have left it under a towel in the bathroom.

name: thejpro
text: Ray's gonna pay the same amount for life-long torture as he does for broken instruments? He may wanna double this to twel'hundo.

name: songbirdspectre
text: it is hoped that horns are modular. OH YES!!!

name: homepie
text: Six hundred dollars is the sincere sorry of the rich man world. Whenever Bill Gates accidentaly offends someone he will be at their doorstep the next day with a bank packet of six hundred dollar bills.

name: carrollhach
text:
http://popwatch.ew.com/popwatch/2007/07/im-in-ur-achewo.html
So satire is now officially DEAD.

name: fuckyoufriday
text: I think that is the single worst achewood write-up I've ever read.

name: ethelthefrog
text: Agreed.

name: wargasmic
text: While reading it, I was imagining a voicing not unlike what Sidney Yamahata would use for an editorial piece on KACW News. Flamboyant, hopelessly contrived, with an overwhelming sense of cheap production.

name: tellumo
text: ARRRRGH. The set of those who read Entertainment Weekly and that of those who read Achewood should be disjoint. (No lame for you, though, because I imagine you got it from some blog of decent repute.)

name: aeon
text: It's like Roast Beef's well-being is a musical instrument, and Ray's accident snapped its strings. Or perhaps Ray just thinks so lowly of Beef that monetary compensation is better than an honest apology.

name: biff
text: I don't see it as Ray thinking lowly of Beef, but instead that he has a fucked up view of the world.  Huck Finn loved and respected Jim, but he still thought that giving him money would eliminate any problems.

name: fuckyoufriday
text: Yeah, ol' fuckin Moneybags Finn.

name: tellumo
text: Compared to Jim, Huck might as well have been a banker.

name: foolishsparrow
text: so the other day at work, i was writing out a check for a beer vendor, and the total was six hundred and something bucks. i almost, completely unconsciously, wrote "six hundo."

name: dasilodavi
text: Is this some sort of multi-alt-text-experiment?  A multexperaltment?  Because it looks to me like a bunch of tiny POST-ITs gawd damn it!

name: quantumcasaba
text:
Actually, the French horn is probably considerably more than a six hundo.
So many dollars, those.
Also, I can't imagine that Cornelius would leave his horn out like that.
Lyle. *shudder*

name: d3athcann0n
text: i used to play one of those horns

name: treasureplane
text: Gets a 5 for "six hundo" having entered the daily lexicon of my girlfriend and I.

name: nonamejoe
text:
This is my all-time favourite Achewood strip. The number of times I've wanted to use "done it up with Christmas lights and a pony"... The "Six Hundred Dollars" two-panel sub-explanation, and finally, "It is hoped that horns are modular." That's one I'd like to use at meetings.

Coworker: We missed our deadline and the client's seriously pissed, but we can give him a 10% discount now to assuage him and then overbill him on the next project.

Me: It is hoped that horns are modular.

Coworker: What?

name: mjfitzge
text: anyone else been referencing this strip a lot since they got their $600 stimulus check?

name: mattylite
text:
ME.
(I AM)

name: tonyhighwind
text:
Class.

Money.

name: lolsworth
text: The narration box is unusually invested in this strip. Maybe Ray done it a six hundo type wrong once too.

name: lordnelson
text: Fortunately many horns ARE modular.

name: mercuri0us
text: Ray has a habit of smashing instuments.

name: masterbbb26
text: My mother gave me six hundred dollars once.....she IS a classy lady
